comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: The suggestion here is very vague, and PowerShell class already has the [`hidden` keyword](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.core/about/about_hidden?view=powershell-7.1) for the 'private' purpose. `hidden` is not the same as `private` in C#, but for similar purpose -- it hides a property/method from the default results of the Get-Member cmdlet, and from IntelliSense and tab completion results.

title: improve classes
